message:
SYSTEM: GeneralOntologies-v3_%28mariano%29.pdf: Página 9
Based on Mariano Fernández-López, Asunción Gómez-Pérez and Mª Carmen Suárez Figuereoa’s work
9
WHAT IS A GENERAL ONTOLOGY?
A common or general ontology specifies the conceptualization of a generic topic 
such as time, space, and mereology, and represents knowledge reusable in 
different domains.
Mizoguchi R, Vanwelkenhuysen J, Ikeda M (1995) Task Ontology for reuse of problem solving knowledge. In: Mars N (ed) Towards Very 
Large Knowledge Bases: Knowledge Building and Knowledge Sharing (KBKS’95). University of Twente, Enschede, The Netherlands. IOS 
Press, Amsterdam, The Netherlands, pp 46–57
van Heijst G, Schreiber ATh, Wielinga BJ (1997) Using explicit ontologies in KBS development. International Journal of Human-Computer 
Studies 45:183–292
speaker: SYSTEM
